Containers.Name: gcloud-backup-docker
Containers.Description: Automatically backup one or more folders to Google Cloud Storage[br][br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Configuration[/span][/u][/b][br] [b]/data[/b] This is where you need to mount your volumes which you want backed up.[br][br] Volumes can be mounted read-only, and you can mount multiple volumes below, for example:[br] - Container volume: /data/documents, Host path: /mnt/user/documents[br] - Container volume: /data/photos, Host path: /mnt/user/media/photos[br][br] You [span style='color: #E80000;']must[/span] set the correct envionment variables for the container. Click on "Advanced view" in the top right and fill in the fields[br] - ACCESS_KEY - your Google Cloud access key[br] - SECRET_KEY - your Google Cloud secret key[br] - GCSPATH - your Google Cloud Storage bucket and path, eg. gs://mybucket/[br] - GCSOPTIONS - Custom parameters to the gsutil command (-d to delete items on the bucken when deleted localy)[br] - CRON_SCHEDULE - Customize how often the backup is executed (default: hourly), "0 3 * * *" for once every night at 3am[br][br]
Containers.Overview: A simple way to backup important files to Google Cloud Storage
